tipText: Always have an escape plan. Zombies may be slow, but panic is deadly.
Duct tape is your best friend. From fixing gear to sealing wounds, it's a survival essential.
Avoid urban areas. High populations mean high zombie concentrations.
Silence is survival. Use melee weapons when possible to avoid attracting a horde.
Keep a map of safe zones and supply caches. Your phone wonâ€™t work forever.
During a zombie outbreak, secure a high-ground shelter with minimal entrance points for maximum safety.
Collect non-perishable food items that require minimal preparation and provide high caloric content.
Always have multiple escape routes planned from any location. Zombies tend to follow noise and movement.
Melee weapons like baseball bats and crowbars are reliable since they don't require ammunition or maintenance.
Rainwater collection systems can provide a sustainable water source when utilities fail.
Learn basic first aid skills before the outbreak. Medical facilities will be inaccessible or overrun.
Bicycles make excellent transportation during a zombie apocalypse - silent, no fuel needed, and faster than walking.
Set up simple noise traps around your perimeter to alert you of approaching zombies or intruders.
Hand-crank radios can help you stay informed about safe zones without requiring batteries.
Travel light. Only pack what you absolutely need in your bug-out bag for maximum mobility.
